TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IInputElement

Docs.summary: Establishes the common events and also the event-related properties and methods for basic input processing by Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!IMPORTANT] > Although this interface is public, it is not intended to be implemented in application or framework-building scenarios. This interface is public because of the inheritance requirements for connecting the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] core to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] framework. You can also use this interface as a casting mechanism to enforce that the input events and properties will come from either a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> or <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement>, which can be handled in the same input model. For more information, see [WPF Architecture](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/wpf-architecture.md) and also see [Base Elements Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/base-elements-overview.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddHandler (System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent, Delegate handler);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AddHandler(class System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent, class System.Delegate handler) cil managed

Docs.param: The identifier for the routed event that is being handled.
A reference to the handler implementation.
Docs.summary: Adds a routed event handler for a specific routed event to an element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CaptureMouse() cil managed

Docs.summary: Attempts to force capture of the mouse to this element.
Docs.returns: if the mouse is successfully captured; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool CaptureStylus() cil managed

Docs.summary: Attempts to force capture of the stylus to this element.
Docs.returns: if the stylus is successfully captured; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Focus() cil managed

Docs.summary: Attempts to focus the keyboard on this element.
Docs.returns: if keyboard focus is moved to this element or already was on this element; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether focus can be set to this element.
Docs.value: if the element can have focus set to it; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.Focusable%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Focusable%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the keyboard is focused on this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the element captures the mouse.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
When an element captures the mouse, that element receives mouse input even if the cursor is outside its bounds. The mouse is typically captured in this manner only during drag-and-drop operations and retains capture until the drop action of the drag-and-drop operation occurs.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the element captures the stylus.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
When an element captures the stylus, that element receives stylus input even if the cursor is outside its bounds. The stylus is typically captured in this manner only during drag-and-drop operations, and retains capture until the drop action of the drag-and-drop operation occurs.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this element is enabled in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].
Docs.value: if the element is enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsEnabled%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsEnabled%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) make this property read/write and establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether this element has keyboard focus.
Docs.value: if this element has keyboard focus; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsKeyboardFocused%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsKeyboardFocused%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether keyboard focus is anywhere inside the element bounds, including if keyboard focus is inside the bounds of any visual child elements.
Docs.value: if keyboard focus is on the element or its child elements; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithin%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithin%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse is captured to this element.
Docs.value: if the element has mouse capture; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsMouseCaptured%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsMouseCaptured%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse pointer is over this element in the strictest hit testing sense.
Docs.value: if the mouse pointer is over this element; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsMouseDirectlyOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsMouseDirectlyOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse pointer is located over this element (including visual children elements that are inside its bounds).
Docs.value: if the mouse pointer is over the element or its child elements; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsMouseOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsMouseOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus is captured to this element.
Docs.value: if the element has stylus capture; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsStylusCaptured%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsStylusCaptured%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus is over this element in the strictest hit testing sense.
Docs.value: if the stylus is over the element; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsStylusDirectlyOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsStylusDirectlyOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus is located over this element (or over visual child elements that are inside its bounds).
Docs.value: if the stylus cursor is over the element or its child elements; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Some core classes that implement <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement>, such as <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>, also implement an event that tracks changes to this property. However, this interface does not include such an event as part of its contract.
Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsStylusOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsStylusOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a key is pressed while the keyboard is focused on this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a key is released while the keyboard is focused on this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the keyboard is no longer focused on this element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Docs.summary: Occurs when this element loses mouse capture.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
When an element captures the mouse, it receives mouse input even if the cursor is outside its borders. The mouse is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations.

Docs.summary: Occurs when this element loses stylus capture.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This interface is not intended for public implementation. For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
When an element captures the stylus, it receives stylus input even if the cursor is outside its borders. The stylus is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the mouse pointer enters the bounds of this element.

MemberSignature.Value: public void RemoveHandler (System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent, Delegate handler);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RemoveHandler(class System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent, class System.Delegate handler) cil managed

Docs.param: Identifier of the routed event for which the handler is attached.
The specific handler implementation to remove from this element's event handler collection.
Docs.summary: Removes all instances of the specified routed event handler from this element.
